chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan R Shackleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Taycheedah Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

04/06/2015 CORRECTED TO ADD 5TH OFFENSE.

superMiscConds.notes:
$750.00 cash bond applied.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia except for drugs prescribed to the Defendant and as prescribed. 
Must maintain absolute sobriety.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Defendant Susan R Shackleton in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Susan R Shackleton in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PSI received by all parties.  Attorney Bachman questions page 5: prior record 5th or 6th.  Attorney Beranek states charged as 5th.  Attorney Bachman has no further questions/corrections.  State has no corrections.
David T. makes statement on behalf of defendant.

Defendant addresses Court.
Court has received letter from Officer Kodesh, Barron County Sheriff's Department, outlining courses completed by Defendant.

Court relates and orders:
Prison - 5 years, 0 months -  2 years, 0 months initial confinement, 3 years, 0 months extended supervision.  Tacheeta Correctional Facility.  58 days credit. 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Not eligible for challenge incarceration.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia except for drugs prescribed to defendant and as precribed.  
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA and DNA Surcharge.
$600.00 fine plus costs.
3 years license revocation.
3 years Ignition Interlock Device.
Bond posted to be applied.

Admonitions given including firearm restrictions and voter's rights.
Voters Ineligibiltiy Form and WEDS filed.
3/25/15 Letter from Jail regarding programming.

Defendant Susan R Shackleton in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3, 4, 7, 12 and 13 are Dismissed and Read-In.  14TR492 is Dismissed.  Bond revoked.  Court orders PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
John Bachman
Bail/Bond.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant must have no contact with Bargain Bill's.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
